result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin X Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the $100.00 cash bond be applied to the court costs, leaving a balance of $343.00.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and to commence immediately.  Defendant is to receive credit for one day served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Danielle at GLSO.
43
Defendant in custody and present via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.

11:36 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.  Statement by the Court - several warrants have been issued for failure to pay.  Court questions defendant regarding employment.  Statement by defendant - have no real job at this time, just babysit and mow lawns.  Court questions defendant regarding payments.  Statement by defendant can pay $30.  Court quashes the warrant.  1) Court orders defendant to pay the fine and costs in full in 30 days or  2) Set up a written payment plan with the COC's office or 3) set up a written community service plan with and approved by the COC's office to perform community service for a public agency or a nonprofit organization, in lieu of payment at a rate of $10.00 per hour.  Failure to do any of the above may result in a warrant being issued forthwith with the defendant being committed to the Green Lake jail for the balance owed.

Court adjourned at 11:38 a.m.
sent to GLSO October 9, 2017
from Clerk to Defendant re: Court-ordered Payment Arrangements
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

Defendant Justin X Hernandez appeared by video means from Dodge County Jail and without counsel.
Court quashes Warrant.
Court orders Defendant to pay $25 per month, beginning September 15, 2017, and continuing the 15th of every month, until paid in full.
Court reminds Defendant of the multiple payment plans that have been set up without payments and questions Defendant whether he'd like to sit time in lieu of payment if he is unable to comply with the payment plan.  Defendant is in agreement.
Court authorizes Warrant - stayed, pending compliance with payment plan.  Court informs Defendant that if he fails to comply with the payment plan, the Court will convert the balance due to jail time at a rate of $80 per day (24 hours).
Court adjourend at 1:17 pm

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Charlene at GLSO.
43

1:00 P.M.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - not sure about getting an attorney.  Court goes over charges.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  DA recites offer - upon plea, will recommend jail and costs.  Defendant requests to accept offer and via video.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-5 days county jail, with huber.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  Court orders the $100 cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.

Court adjourned at 1:08 p.m.

Note - After court, judge said that the sentence was to commence immediately and defendant is to receive credit for any time served.
